author: draganrakita
content: Update EIP-7873: unban TXCREATE in legac...

author: draganrakita
content: to write it here too, alternatively we could make a `FRACTION` part of `EXT*CALL`'s input and with it remove a need for `PAY` opcode.

author: draganrakita
content: Can someone explain to me why we are introducing new Initcode tx type, and can't continue using data from Legacy creation tx? https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/blob/master/EIPS/eip-7698.md

author: _shemnon
content: CREATE factories.  We need a way to bring multiple contracts to bear in a single TX and address them by content.  Such as in an AA aggregated transaction.

author: _shemnon
content: Three user operations, each deploying a contract.  We can put all three in a single aggregated TX for the entry point and load their contracts into the initcode.  TXCREATE addresses by hash, so we can order the contracts as needed (vs 3 UOs all referencing slot 1)

author: draganrakita
content: Aha in previous way you could only deploy one contract per tx as it is a create. Thanks
